conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C and needs to be predicted whether it flows into container D or E after passing through baffles.
Liquid starts flowing from points A, B, and C.
Liquid from A flows downward and encounters a purple baffle.
Liquid from A flows around the purple baffle and heads towards the orange structure labeled D.
Liquid from B flows downward, bypassing the white baffle.
Liquid from B continues straight down towards the orange structure labeled D.
Liquid from C flows downward and encounters the cyan baffle.
Liquid from C flows around the cyan baffle towards the brown structure labeled E.
Liquid from A and B merges and flows towards the orange structure labeled D.
Liquid from C flows toward the brown structure labeled E.
The combined flow from A and B will go into container D.
The flow from C will go into container E.
Based on the analysis, the liquid from A and B will flow into container D, and the liquid from C will flow into container E.
The liquid will flow into container D.
